skill.name: qiskit
skill.description: Comprehensive quantum computing toolkit for building, optimizing, and executing quantum circuits. Use when working with quantum algorithms, simulations, or quantum hardware including (1) Building quantum circuits with gates and measurements, (2) Running quantum algorithms (VQE, QAOA, Grover), (3) Transpiling/optimizing circuits for hardware, (4) Executing on IBM Quantum or other providers, (5) Quantum chemistry and materials science, (6) Quantum machine learning, (7) Visualizing circuits and results, or (8) Any quantum computing development task.
skill.summary: Comprehensive quantum computing toolkit for building, optimizing, and executing quantum circuits. Us...
skill.author: K-Dense-AI

security_audit.summary: This is a documentation-only skill providing Qiskit quantum computing tutorials and examples. No executable code, network calls, or file system access. Pure educational content.

content.value_statement: Qiskit enables you to build, optimize, and execute quantum circuits on real quantum computers. Solve complex problems in optimization, chemistry, and machine learning using quantum algorithms.
actual_capabilities: Build quantum circuits with gates and measurements
Run quantum algorithms like VQE, QAOA, and Grover's
Optimize circuits for quantum hardware using transpilation
Execute on IBM Quantum, IonQ, and Amazon Braket backends
limitations: Requires IBM Quantum account for hardware access
Quantum computers have limited qubits and high error rates
Some algorithms need many iterations to converge

use_cases.title: Quantum Chemistry Simulations
use_cases.description: Calculate molecular ground state energies using VQE algorithm for drug discovery and materials science

use_cases.title: Quantum Machine Learning
use_cases.description: Implement quantum kernels and variational quantum classifiers for pattern recognition tasks

use_cases.title: Combinatorial Optimization
use_cases.description: Solve MaxCut, TSP, and scheduling problems using QAOA on quantum hardware

prompt_templates.title: Create Bell State
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a quantum circuit that generates a Bell state (entangled qubits) and measure both qubits

prompt_templates.title: Implement Grover's Algorithm
prompt_templates.prompt: Implement Grover's algorithm to search for the state |101⟩ in a 3-qubit system

prompt_templates.title: VQE for H2 Molecule
prompt_templates.prompt: Use VQE to calculate the ground state energy of an H2 molecule with bond length 0.735 Å

prompt_templates.title: Optimize Circuit for Hardware
prompt_templates.prompt: Transpile a quantum circuit for the ibm_brisbane backend with optimization level 3

output_examples.input: Create a quantum circuit that generates entanglement between two qubits
output: • Applied CNOT gate with control=0, target=1

best_practices: Always test with simulators before running on quantum hardware
Use optimization_level=3 for production circuits to minimize errors
Monitor convergence when running variational algorithms like VQE
anti_patterns: Running large circuits without transpilation for specific hardware
Using too many shots during algorithm development (start with 100-1000)
Ignoring qubit connectivity when designing circuits for real hardware

faq.question: Do I need an IBM Quantum account to use Qiskit?
faq.answer: No, you can use local simulators. An IBM Quantum account is only needed for real quantum hardware access.

faq.question: What Python version does Qiskit support?
faq.answer: Qiskit typically supports Python 3.8+. Check the PyPI page for current requirements.

faq.question: How do I choose between Sampler and Estimator primitives?
faq.answer: Use Sampler for bitstring measurements (optimization algorithms) and Estimator for expectation values (chemistry, physics).

faq.question: Is my data safe when using IBM Quantum hardware?
faq.answer: IBM Quantum handles circuit execution but doesn't store your intellectual property. Always review provider privacy policies.

faq.question: Why is my circuit producing different results on hardware vs simulator?
faq.answer: Quantum hardware has noise and errors. Use error mitigation and increase shots for better results.

faq.question: How do I handle long queue times on IBM Quantum?
faq.answer: Use the least_busy() backend selection or run jobs in batch mode for independent circuits.
